title: Canadian High Schools Model United Nations (CAHSMUN)
description: CAHSMUN is one of the flagship Canadian high school MUN conferences and a serious training ground for delegates who want fast paced debate without the intimidation factor of the US mega conferences. It attracts strong school delegations and rewards clear policy thinking, disciplined procedure, and coalition building. If you want a reputable North American conference with a competitive but educational vibe, CAHSMUN is a classic pick.
format: Committee sessions -> Draft resolutions -> Negotiation blocs -> Voting and awards (committee offerings vary by year)
eligibility: High school students (typically Grade 8-12); school delegations and independent delegates depending on conference policy
howToApply: 1. Open the official listing. 2. Locate the CAHSMUN page or host link. 3. Register a delegation or individual account if offered. 4. Pay fees if required. 5. Submit country and committee preferences by the posted deadline.

title: Canada International Model United Nations (CAIMUN)
description: CAIMUN is positioned as an internationally oriented Canadian conference and is a strong option for students who want global themed committees and a diverse delegate pool. It is often chosen by schools building a balanced MUN season because it blends skills building with meaningful competition. Expect solid chairing standards and plenty of opportunities to practice both formal speeches and informal negotiation.
format: Opening session -> Committee debates -> Working papers -> Draft resolutions -> Voting and awards
eligibility: High school students (typically Grade 8-12); school delegations and independent delegates depending on conference policy
howToApply: 1. Open the official listing. 2. Find CAIMUN details and host page. 3. Register delegation or individual entry as allowed. 4. Confirm payment and assignments. 5. Prepare position paper if required.

title: Ontario Model United Nations (OMUN)
description: OMUN is a well known Ontario circuit conference that many schools treat as a major milestone in the season because it is competitive, structured, and reliably organized. It is a great place to sharpen real committee skills like drafting, merging, and negotiating under time pressure. If you want a conference that feels serious but still accessible, OMUN is a strong bet.
format: Opening ceremonies -> Committee sessions -> Working paper drafting -> Draft resolution debate -> Voting and awards
eligibility: High school students (typically Grade 9-12); participation as a school delegation is common
howToApply: 1. Go to the OMUN site. 2. Create or locate delegation registration. 3. Submit delegation size and school details. 4. Pay fees. 5. Complete country and committee selections by the deadlines posted.

If you want a reputable regional conference that is accessible and intense, CHEMUN is a solid pick.
format: Opening session -> Committee debates -> Working papers -> Draft resolutions -> Voting and awards
eligibility: High school students (typically Grade 8-12); school delegations and independent delegates depending on conference policy
howToApply: 1. Open the THIMUN upcoming conferences page. 2. Find CHEMUN. 3. Register via host instructions for delegations or individuals. 4. Pay fees if required. 5. Submit committee preferences and required documents by deadlines.
